title: I.Sicily inscription 001660
support: Although consistently described as marble in publications, the stone is a compact limestone, not a marble, in the form of a thick slab/plaque.

handNote.lettering: Regular and neat letters without serifs. Alpha with both straight and broken bar, beta with closed loops (upper slightly smaller), Mu has full length slanting strokes; omicron full size; sigma has horizontal top and bottom; rhomboid omega.

date._: 2nd or 1st century BCE (as late as early Augustan acc. to Wilson and Manni Piraino; but Manni Piraino also suggests 2nd century BCE). The form of the letters surely suggests an earlier date in this range.
